user.description:
This field is being replaced by `safety_identifier` and `prompt_cache_key`. Use `prompt_cache_key` instead to maintain caching optimizations.
  A stable identifier for your end-users.
  Used to boost cache hit rates by better bucketing similar requests and  to help OpenAI detect and prevent abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

safety_identifier.description:
A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating OpenAI's usage policies.
  The IDs should be a string that uniquely identifies each user. We recommend hashing their username or email address, in order to avoid sending us any identifying information. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

prompt_cache_key.description: Used by OpenAI to cache responses for similar requests to optimize your cache hit rates. Replaces the `user` field. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-caching).

service_tier.description: Note: service_tier is not applicable to Azure OpenAI.

model.description: The model deployment to use for the creation of this response.

tools.description:
An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You
can specify which tool to use by setting the `tool_choice` parameter.

The two categories of tools you can provide the model are:

- **Built-in tools**: Tools that are provided by OpenAI that extend the
  model's capabilities, like file search.
- **Function calls (custom tools)**: Functions that are defined by you,
  enabling the model to call your own code.

agent.description: The agent to use for generating the response.

structured_inputs.description: The structured inputs to the response that can participate in prompt template substitution or tool argument bindings.

Metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.
Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

ServiceTier.description:
Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.
- If set to 'auto', then the request will be processed with the service tier configured in the Project settings. Unless otherwise configured, the Project will use 'default'.
- If set to 'default', then the request will be processed with the standard pricing and performance for the selected model.
- If set to '[flex](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/flex-processing)' or '[priority](https://openai.com/api-priority-processing/)', then the request will be processed with the corresponding service tier.
- When not set, the default behavior is 'auto'.
When the `service_tier` parameter is set, the response body will include the `service_tier` value based on the processing mode actually used to serve the request. This response value may be different from the value set in the parameter.

Reasoning.description:
**gpt-5 and o-series models only**
Configuration options for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).
Reasoning.title: Reasoning

ResponseTextParam.description:
Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain
text or structured JSON data. Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text)
- [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs)

ToolsArray.description:
An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You
can specify which tool to use by setting the `tool_choice` parameter.
We support the following categories of tools:
- **Built-in tools**: Tools that are provided by OpenAI that extend the
model's capabilities, like [web search](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search)
or [file search](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search). Learn more about
[built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).
- **MCP Tools**: Integrations with third-party systems via custom MCP servers
or predefined connectors such as Google Drive and SharePoint. Learn more about
[MCP Tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-connectors-mcp).
- **Function calls (custom tools)**: Functions that are defined by you,
enabling the model to call your own code with strongly typed arguments
and outputs. Learn more about
[function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling). You can also use
custom tools to call your own code.

ToolChoiceParam.description:
How the model should select which tool (or tools) to use when generating
a response. See the `tools` parameter to see how to specify which tools
the model can call.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

Prompt.description:
Reference to a prompt template and its variables.
[Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text?api-mode=responses#reusable-prompts).

InputParam.description:
Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response.
Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text)
- [Image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/images)
- [File inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/pdf-files)
- [Conversation state](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state)
- [Function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling)

IncludeEnum.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
- `web_search_call.action.sources`: Include the sources of the web search tool call.
- `code_interpreter_call.outputs`: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `message.output_text.logprobs`: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- `reasoning.encrypted_content`: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the `store` parameter is set to `false`, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

include_obfuscation.description:
When true, stream obfuscation will be enabled. Stream obfuscation adds
  random characters to an `obfuscation` field on streaming delta events to
  normalize payload sizes as a mitigation to certain side-channel attacks.
  These obfuscation fields are included by default, but add a small amount
  of overhead to the data stream. You can set `include_obfuscation` to
  false to optimize for bandwidth if you trust the network links between
  your application and the OpenAI API.

ResponseStreamOptions.description: Options for streaming responses. Only set this when you set `stream: true`.

ConversationParam.description:
The conversation that this response belongs to. Items from this conversation are prepended to `input_items` for this response request.
Input items and output items from this response are automatically added to this conversation after this response completes.

version.description: The version identifier of the agent.

ReasoningEffort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).
Currently supported values are `none`, `minimal`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, and `xhigh`. Reducing
reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used
on reasoning in a response.
- `gpt-5.1` defaults to `none`, which does not perform reasoning. The supported reasoning values for `gpt-5.1` are `none`, `low`, `medium`, and `high`. Tool calls are supported for all reasoning values in gpt-5.1.
- All models before `gpt-5.1` default to `medium` reasoning effort, and do not support `none`.
- The `gpt-5-pro` model defaults to (and only supports) `high` reasoning effort.
- `xhigh` is supported for all models after `gpt-5.1-codex-max`.

TextResponseFormatConfiguration.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.
Configuring `{ "type": "json_schema" }` enables Structured Outputs,
which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema. Learn more in the
[Structured Outputs guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).
The default format is `{ "type": "text" }` with no additional options.
*Not recommended for gpt-4o and newer models:**
Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables the older JSON mode, which
ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON. Using `json_schema`
is preferred for models that support it.

Verbosity.description:
Constrains the verbosity of the model's response. Lower values will result in
more concise responses, while higher values will result in more verbose responses.
Currently supported values are `low`, `medium`, and `high`.

Tool.description: A tool that can be used to generate a response.

type.description: Allowed tool configuration type. Always `allowed_tools`.

mode.description:
Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.
  `auto` allows the model to pick from among the allowed tools and generate a
  message.
  `required` requires the model to call one or more of the allowed tools.

tools.description:
A list of tool definitions that the model should be allowed to call.
  For the Responses API, the list of tool definitions might look like:
  ```json
  [
    { "type": "function", "name": "get_weather" },
    { "type": "mcp", "server_label": "deepwiki" },
    { "type": "image_generation" }
  ]
  ```

ToolChoiceAllowed.description: Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.
ToolChoiceAllowed.title: Allowed tools

type.description: For function calling, the type is always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

ToolChoiceFunction.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific function.
ToolChoiceFunction.title: Function tool

type.description: For MCP tools, the type is always `mcp`.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server to use.

ToolChoiceMCP.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific tool on a remote MCP server.
ToolChoiceMCP.title: MCP tool

type.description: For custom tool calling, the type is always `custom`.

name.description: The name of the custom tool to call.

ToolChoiceCustom.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific custom tool.
ToolChoiceCustom.title: Custom tool

type.description: The tool to call. Always `apply_patch`.

SpecificApplyPatchParam.description: Forces the model to call the apply_patch tool when executing a tool call.
SpecificApplyPatchParam.title: Specific apply patch tool choice

type.description: The tool to call. Always `shell`.

SpecificFunctionShellParam.description: Forces the model to call the shell tool when a tool call is required.
SpecificFunctionShellParam.title: Specific shell tool choice

ToolChoiceFileSearch.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

ToolChoiceWebSearchPreview.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

ToolChoiceComputerUsePreview.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

ToolChoiceWebSearchPreview20250311.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

ToolChoiceImageGeneration.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

ToolChoiceCodeInterpreter.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

ResponsePromptVariables.description:
Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your
prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other
Response input types like images or files.
ResponsePromptVariables.title: Prompt Variables

id.description: The unique ID of the conversation.

ConversationParam-2.description: The conversation that this response belongs to.
ConversationParam-2.title: Conversation object

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

description.description:
A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to
  determine how to respond in the format.

name.description:
The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain
  underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

TextResponseFormatJsonSchema.description:
JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.
Learn more about [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).
TextResponseFormatJsonSchema.title: JSON schema

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `text`.

TextResponseFormatConfigurationResponseF.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.
TextResponseFormatConfigurationResponseF.title: Text

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_object`.

TextResponseFormatConfigurationResponseF.description:
JSON object response format. An older method of generating JSON responses.
Using `json_schema` is recommended for models that support it. Note that the
model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it
to do so.
TextResponseFormatConfigurationResponseF.title: JSON object

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool. Always `code_interpreter`.

container.description:
The code interpreter container. Can be a container ID or an object that
  specifies uploaded file IDs to make available to your code, along with an
  optional `memory_limit` setting.

CodeInterpreterTool.description: A tool that runs Python code to help generate a response to a prompt.
CodeInterpreterTool.title: Code interpreter

type.description: The type of the function tool. Always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

FunctionTool.description: Defines a function in your own code the model can choose to call. Learn more about [function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).
FunctionTool.title: Function

type.description: The type of the file search tool. Always `file_search`.

vector_store_ids.description: The IDs of the vector stores to search.

max_num_results.description: The maximum number of results to return. This number should be between 1 and 50 inclusive.

FileSearchTool.description: A tool that searches for relevant content from uploaded files. Learn more about the [file search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search).
FileSearchTool.title: File search

type.description: The type of the computer use tool. Always `computer_use_preview`.

environment.description: The type of computer environment to control.

display_width.description: The width of the computer display.

display_height.description: The height of the computer display.

ComputerUsePreviewTool.description: A tool that controls a virtual computer. Learn more about the [computer tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-computer-use).
ComputerUsePreviewTool.title: Computer use preview

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of `web_search` or `web_search_2025_08_26`.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of `low`, `medium`, or `high`. `medium` is the default.

WebSearchTool.description:
Search the Internet for sources related to the prompt. Learn more about the
[web search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search).
WebSearchTool.title: Web search

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always `mcp`.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description:
The URL for the MCP server. One of `server_url` or `connector_id` must be
  provided.

connector_id.description:
Identifier for service connectors, like those available in ChatGPT. One of
  `server_url` or `connector_id` must be provided. Learn more about service
  connectors [here](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp#connectors).
  Currently supported `connector_id` values are:
  - Dropbox: `connector_dropbox`
  - Gmail: `connector_gmail`
  - Google Calendar: `connector_googlecalendar`
  - Google Drive: `connector_googledrive`
  - Microsoft Teams: `connector_microsoftteams`
  - Outlook Calendar: `connector_outlookcalendar`
  - Outlook Email: `connector_outlookemail`
  - SharePoint: `connector_sharepoint`

authorization.description:
An OAuth access token that can be used with a remote MCP server, either
  with a custom MCP server URL or a service connector. Your application
  must handle the OAuth authorization flow and provide the token here.

server_description.description: Optional description of the MCP server, used to provide more context.

project_connection_id.description: The connection ID in the project for the MCP server. The connection stores authentication and other connection details needed to connect to the MCP server.

MCPTool.description:
Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol
(MCP) servers. [Learn more about MCP](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp).
MCPTool.title: MCP tool

type.description: The type of the image generation tool. Always `image_generation`.

quality.description:
The quality of the generated image. One of `low`, `medium`, `high`,
  or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

size.description:
The size of the generated image. One of `1024x1024`, `1024x1536`,
  `1536x1024`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

output_format.description:
The output format of the generated image. One of `png`, `webp`, or
  `jpeg`. Default: `png`.

output_compression.description: Compression level for the output image. Default: 100.

moderation.description: Moderation level for the generated image. Default: `auto`.

background.description:
Background type for the generated image. One of `transparent`,
  `opaque`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

input_image_mask.description:
Optional mask for inpainting. Contains `image_url`
  (string, optional) and `file_id` (string, optional).

partial_images.description: Number of partial images to generate in streaming mode, from 0 (default value) to 3.

ImageGenTool.description: A tool that generates images using the GPT image models.
ImageGenTool.title: Image generation tool

type.description: The type of the local shell tool. Always `local_shell`.

LocalShellToolParam.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.
LocalShellToolParam.title: Local shell tool

type.description: The type of the shell tool. Always `shell`.

FunctionShellToolParam.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands.
FunctionShellToolParam.title: Shell tool

type.description: The type of the custom tool. Always `custom`.

name.description: The name of the custom tool, used to identify it in tool calls.

description.description: Optional description of the custom tool, used to provide more context.

format.description: The input format for the custom tool. Default is unconstrained text.

CustomToolParam.description: A custom tool that processes input using a specified format. Learn more about   [custom tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling#custom-tools)
CustomToolParam.title: Custom tool

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of `web_search_preview` or `web_search_preview_2025_03_11`.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of `low`, `medium`, or `high`. `medium` is the default.

custom_search_configuration.description:
The project connections attached to this tool. There can be a maximum of 1 connection
resource attached to the tool.

WebSearchPreviewTool.description: This tool searches the web for relevant results to use in a response. Learn more about the [web search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search).
WebSearchPreviewTool.title: Web search preview

type.description: The type of the tool. Always `apply_patch`.

ApplyPatchToolParam.description: Allows the assistant to create, delete, or update files using unified diffs.
ApplyPatchToolParam.title: Apply patch tool

type.description: The object type, which is always 'bing_grounding'.

bing_grounding.description: The bing grounding search tool parameters.

BingGroundingAgentTool.description: The input definition information for a bing grounding search tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'fabric_dataagent'.

fabric_dataagent_preview.description: The fabric data agent tool parameters.

MicrosoftFabricAgentTool.description: The input definition information for a Microsoft Fabric tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'sharepoint_grounding'.

SharepointAgentTool.description: The input definition information for a sharepoint tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'azure_ai_search'.

azure_ai_search.description: The azure ai search index resource.

AzureAISearchAgentTool.description: The input definition information for an Azure AI search tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'openapi'.

OpenApiAgentTool.description: The input definition information for an OpenAPI tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'bing_custom_search'.

bing_custom_search_preview.description: The bing custom search tool parameters.

BingCustomSearchAgentTool.description: The input definition information for a Bing custom search tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'browser_automation'.

BrowserAutomationAgentTool.description: The input definition information for a Browser Automation Tool, as used to configure an Agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'browser_automation'.

AzureFunctionAgentTool.description: The input definition information for an Azure Function Tool, as used to configure an Agent.

type.description: The type of the tool. Always `capture_structured_outputs`.

outputs.description: The structured outputs to capture from the model.

CaptureStructuredOutputsTool.description: A tool for capturing structured outputs

type.description: The type of the tool. Always `a2a`.

agent_card_path.description:
The path to the agent card relative to the `base_url`.
If not provided, defaults to  `/.well-known/agent-card.json`

project_connection_id.description:
The connection ID in the project for the A2A server.
The connection stores authentication and other connection details needed to connect to the A2A server.

A2ATool.description: An agent implementing the A2A protocol.

type.description: The type of the tool. Always `memory_search`.

memory_store_name.description: The name of the memory store to use.

scope.description:
The namespace used to group and isolate memories, such as a user ID.
Limits which memories can be retrieved or updated.
Use special variable `{{$userId}}` to scope memories to the current signed-in user.

search_options.description: Options for searching the memory store.

update_delay.description: Time to wait before updating memories after inactivity (seconds). Default 300.

MemorySearchTool.description: A tool for integrating memories into the agent.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

text.description: The text input to the model.

InputTextContent.description: A text input to the model.
InputTextContent.title: Input text

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

detail.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.

InputImageContent.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision).
InputImageContent.title: Input image

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_file`.

filename.description: The name of the file to be sent to the model.

file_url.description: The URL of the file to be sent to the model.

file_data.description: The content of the file to be sent to the model.

InputFileContent.description: A file input to the model.
InputFileContent.title: Input file

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
  `developer`.

content.description:
Text, image, or audio input to the model, used to generate a response.
  Can also contain previous assistant responses.

EasyInputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.
EasyInputMessage.title: Input message

type.description: The type of item to reference. Always `item_reference`.

id.description: The ID of the item to reference.

ItemReferenceParam.description: An internal identifier for an item to reference.
ItemReferenceParam.title: Item reference

ResponseFormatJsonSchemaSchema.description:
The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.
Learn how to build JSON schemas [here](https://json-schema.org/).
ResponseFormatJsonSchemaSchema.title: JSON schema

type.description: Always `auto`.

file_ids.description: An optional list of uploaded files to make available to your code.

CodeInterpreterContainerAuto.description: Configuration for a code interpreter container. Optionally specify the IDs of the files to run the code on.
CodeInterpreterContainerAuto.title: CodeInterpreterToolAuto

ranker.description: The ranker to use for the file search.

score_threshold.description: The score threshold for the file search, a number between 0 and 1. Numbers closer to 1 will attempt to return only the most relevant results, but may return fewer results.

hybrid_search.description: Weights that control how reciprocal rank fusion balances semantic embedding matches versus sparse keyword matches when hybrid search is enabled.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always `approximate`.

WebSearchApproximateLocation.description: The approximate location of the user.
WebSearchApproximateLocation.title: Web search approximate location

read_only.description:
Indicates whether or not a tool modifies data or is read-only. If an
  MCP server is [annotated with `readOnlyHint`](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-06-18/schema#toolannotations-readonlyhint),
  it will match this filter.

MCPToolFilter.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.
MCPToolFilter.title: MCP tool filter

InputFidelity.description: Control how much effort the model will exert to match the style and features, especially facial features, of input images. This parameter is only supported for `gpt-image-1`. Unsupported for `gpt-image-1-mini`. Supports `high` and `low`. Defaults to `low`.

CustomToolParamFormat.description: The input format for the custom tool. Default is unconstrained text.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always `approximate`.

project_connection_id.description: Project connection id for grounding with bing custom search

instance_name.description: Name of the custom configuration instance given to config.

WebSearchConfiguration.description: A web search configuration for bing custom search

search_configurations.description:
The search configurations attached to this tool. There can be a maximum of 1
search configuration resource attached to the tool.

BingGroundingSearchToolParameters.description: The bing grounding search tool parameters.

project_connections.description:
The project connections attached to this tool. There can be a maximum of 1 connection
resource attached to the tool.

FabricDataAgentToolParameters.description: The fabric data agent tool parameters.

project_connections.description:
The project connections attached to this tool. There can be a maximum of 1 connection
resource attached to the tool.

indexes.description:
The indices attached to this agent. There can be a maximum of 1 index
resource attached to the agent.

AzureAISearchToolResource.description: A set of index resources used by the `azure_ai_search` tool.

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

spec.description: The openapi function shape, described as a JSON Schema object.

default_params.description: List of OpenAPI spec parameters that will use user-provided defaults

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

parameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

functions.description: List of function definitions used by OpenApi tool

OpenApiFunctionDefinition.description: The input definition information for an openapi function.

search_configurations.description:
The project connections attached to this tool. There can be a maximum of 1 connection
resource attached to the tool.

BingCustomSearchToolParameters.description: The bing custom search tool parameters.

connection.description: The project connection parameters associated with the Browser Automation Tool.

BrowserAutomationToolParameters.description: Definition of input parameters for the Browser Automation Tool.

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

parameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

function.description: The definition of azure function and its parameters.

input_binding.description: Input storage queue. The queue storage trigger runs a function as messages are added to it.

output_binding.description: Output storage queue. The function writes output to this queue when the input items are processed.

name.description: The name of the structured output.

description.description: A description of the output to emit. Used by the model to determine when to emit the output.

schema.description: The JSON schema for the structured output.

strict.description: Whether to enforce strict validation. Default `true`.

StructuredOutputDefinition.description: A structured output that can be produced by the agent.

max_memories.description: Maximum number of memory items to return.

InputMessageContentList.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content
types.
InputMessageContentList.title: Input item content list

embedding_weight.description: The weight of the embedding in the reciprocal ranking fusion.

text_weight.description: The weight of the text in the reciprocal ranking fusion.

type.description:
Specifies the comparison operator: `eq`, `ne`, `gt`, `gte`, `lt`, `lte`, `in`, `nin`.
  - `eq`: equals
  - `ne`: not equal
  - `gt`: greater than
  - `gte`: greater than or equal
  - `lt`: less than
  - `lte`: less than or equal
  - `in`: in
  - `nin`: not in

key.description: The key to compare against the value.

value.description: The value to compare against the attribute key; supports string, number, or boolean types.

ComparisonFilter.description: A filter used to compare a specified attribute key to a given value using a defined comparison operation.
ComparisonFilter.title: Comparison Filter

type.description: Type of operation: `and` or `or`.

filters.description: Array of filters to combine. Items can be `ComparisonFilter` or `CompoundFilter`.

type.description: Unconstrained text format. Always `text`.
Grammar format. Always `grammar`.

syntax.description: The syntax of the grammar definition. One of `lark` or `regex`.

CustomGrammarFormatParam.description: A grammar defined by the user.
CustomGrammarFormatParam.title: Grammar format

project_connection_id.description: Project connection id for grounding with bing search

market.description: The market where the results come from.

set_lang.description: The language to use for user interface strings when calling Bing API.

count.description: The number of search results to return in the bing api response

freshness.description: Filter search results by a specific time range. See [accepted values here](https://learn.microsoft.com/bing/search-apis/bing-web-search/reference/query-parameters).

project_connection_id.description: A project connection in a ToolProjectConnectionList attached to this tool.
An index connection ID in an IndexResource attached to this agent.

index_name.description: The name of an index in an IndexResource attached to this agent.

query_type.description: Type of query in an AIIndexResource attached to this agent.

top_k.description: Number of documents to retrieve from search and present to the model.

filter.description: filter string for search resource. [Learn more here](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/search-filters).

index_asset_id.description: Index asset id for search resource.

type.description: The type of authentication, must be anonymous/project_connection/managed_identity

project_connection_id.description: Project connection id for grounding with bing search

instance_name.description: Name of the custom configuration instance given to config.

market.description: The market where the results come from.

set_lang.description: The language to use for user interface strings when calling Bing API.

count.description: The number of search results to return in the bing api response

freshness.description: Filter search results by a specific time range. See [accepted values here](https://learn.microsoft.com/bing/search-apis/bing-web-search/reference/query-parameters).

project_connection_id.description: The ID of the project connection to your Azure Playwright resource.

BrowserAutomationToolConnectionParameter.description: Definition of input parameters for the connection used by the Browser Automation Tool.

type.description: The type of binding, which is always 'storage_queue'.

AzureFunctionBinding.description: The structure for keeping storage queue name and URI.

AzureAISearchQueryType.description: Available query types for Azure AI Search tool.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'anonymous'.

OpenApiAnonymousAuthDetails.description: Security details for OpenApi anonymous authentication

type.description: The object type, which is always 'project_connection'.

OpenApiProjectConnectionAuthDetails.description: Security details for OpenApi project connection authentication

type.description: The object type, which is always 'managed_identity'.

OpenApiManagedAuthDetails.description: Security details for OpenApi managed_identity authentication

OpenApiAuthType.description:
Authentication type for OpenApi endpoint. Allowed types are:
- Anonymous (no authentication required)
- Project Connection (requires project_connection_id to endpoint, as setup in AI Foundry)
- Managed_Identity (requires audience for identity based auth)

queue_service_endpoint.description: URI to the Azure Storage Queue service allowing you to manipulate a queue.

queue_name.description: The name of an Azure function storage queue.

AzureFunctionStorageQueue.description: The structure for keeping storage queue name and URI.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

text.description: The text input to the model.

InputContentInputTextContent.description: A text input to the model.
InputContentInputTextContent.title: Input text

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

detail.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.

InputContentInputImageContent.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision).
InputContentInputImageContent.title: Input image

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_file`.

filename.description: The name of the file to be sent to the model.

file_url.description: The URL of the file to be sent to the model.

file_data.description: The content of the file to be sent to the model.

InputContentInputFileContent.description: A file input to the model.
InputContentInputFileContent.title: Input file

project_connection_id.description: Project connection id for Project Connection auth type

OpenApiProjectConnectionSecurityScheme.description: Security scheme for OpenApi managed_identity authentication

audience.description: Authentication scope for managed_identity auth type

OpenApiManagedSecurityScheme.description: Security scheme for OpenApi managed_identity authentication
